intro: Roepera crenata, commonly known as the scalycup mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, scalloped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Roepera crenata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
